analyzed: first ed in msu
uddānam
translated: The summary:

original: kauṇḍinyo nandīpālaś ca modakā udakaṃ pibet /
analyzed: kauṇḍinyaḥ nandīpālaḥ ca modakāḥ udakam pibet
translated: Kauṇḍinya, Nandīpāla, and Modaka, one should drink water,

analyzed: pūpakaḥ madhuvāsiṣṭhaḥ vinaya agram gaṇitena ca
translated: Pūpaka, Madhuvāsiṣṭha, the foremost in discipline, and with calculation.

original: karakaḥ kalabhuś caiva viśvabhug vanarathena ca /
analyzed: karakaḥ kalabhuḥ ca eva viśvabhuj vana rathena ca
translated: Karaka and Kalabha, and Viśvabhū, and with the forest chariot,

analyzed: chatram kītaśirā maitrī tathā ghaṇṭena ghoṣitā
translated: An umbrella, a song, Śirāmāitrī, and thus proclaimed with a bell.

original: yadā āyuṣmatā kauṇḍinyena sarvakleśaprahāṇād arhatvaṃ sākṣātkṛtam iti
analyzed: yadā āyuṣmatā kauṇḍinyena sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam iti
translated: When the Venerable Kauṇḍinya realized arhatship through the complete abandonment of all defilements,

analyzed: bhagavatā saṅghāṭī dhvaja dhāriṇām agraḥ nirdiṣṭaḥ
translated: he was declared by the Blessed One to be foremost among those who wear the upper robe as a banner.

original: tadā bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: tadā bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: Then the monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, who removes all doubts:

original: kiṃ bhadanta āyuṣmatā kauṇḍinyena karma kṛtam yena bhagavatā saṅghāṭīdhvajadhāriṇām agro nirdiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: kim bhadanta āyuṣmatā kauṇḍinyena karma kṛtam yena bhagavatā saṅghāṭī dhvaja dhāriṇām agraḥ nirdiṣṭaḥ
translated: Venerable sir, what deed was done by the Venerable Kauṇḍinya that he was declared by the Blessed One to be foremost among those who wear the upper robe as a banner?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kauṇḍinyena bhikṣuṇā karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāny oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyabhāvīni /
analyzed: kauṇḍinyena bhikṣuṇā karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśya bhāvīni
translated: Monks, the deeds were done and accumulated by the monk Kauṇḍinya, whose requisites were obtained and whose conditions were fulfilled, like a flood. They have presented themselves, and he must surely experience their results.

original: kauṇḍinyenaiva karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni ko 'nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kauṇḍinyena eva karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni kaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Koundinya himself performed and accumulated the actions. Who else will experience them?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /🔽na tejodhātau /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni bāhye pṛthivī dhātau vipacyante  na ap dhātau  na tejaḥ dhātau
translated: Monks, actions that have been performed and accumulated are not ripened in the external earth element.🔽Nor in the water element.🔽Nor in the fire element.

analyzed: na vāyudhātau sbv ii
translated: Nor in the wind element.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca
translated: But rather, actions that have been performed and accumulated are ripened in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been appropriated, both wholesome and unwholesome.

original: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇy api kalpaśatair api /
analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api
translated: Actions do not perish even after hundreds of eons.

original: sāmagrīm prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām //
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: When the conditions are complete and the time has come, they certainly bear fruit for embodied beings.

analyzed: story of kauṇḍinya
translated: The Story of Koundinya

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavaḥ asminn eva bhadrake kalpe varṣasahasrāyuṣi prajāyāṃ kāśyapo nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ asmin eva bhadrake kalpe varṣa sahasra āyuṣi prajāyām kāśyapaḥ nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: Monks, in the past, in this very fortunate eon, when the lifespan of beings was one thousand years, a perfectly awakened buddha named Kashyapa appeared in the world.

original: vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He was accomplished in knowledge and conduct, a blissful one, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed lord.

original: sa vārāṇasīṃ nagarīm upaniśritya viharati karakacchedake parvate /
analyzed: sa vārāṇasīm nagarīm upaniśritya viharati karakacchedake parvate
translated: He lived and dwelt near the city of Varanasi, on the hill called Karakaccheda.

original: yāvad apareṇa samayena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya /
analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya
translated: Later, at another time, the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, having dressed in the morning,

analyzed: pātra cīvaram ādāya vārāṇasīm praviśati
translated: taking his bowl and robe, entered Vārāṇasī.

analyzed: pañca mātrāṇi ca goṣṭhika śatāni nirgacchanti
translated: And five hundred groups of students went out.

original: adrākśus te goṣṭhikās taṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛtam /
analyzed: adrākśuḥ te goṣṭhikāḥ tam buddham bhagavantam dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṅkṛtam
translated: The groups saw that Buddha, the Blessed One, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

analyzed: aśityā ca anuvyañjanaiḥ virājita gatram
translated: his body radiant with the eighty minor marks,

analyzed: vyāma prabhā alaṅkṛtam
translated: adorned with a fathom-wide aura,

analyzed: sūrya sahasra atireka prabham
translated: shining with a light surpassing the sun and moon,

analyzed: jaṅgamam iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam
translated: like a moving jeweled mountain, beautiful in every way.

original: sahadarśanāc ca prasādajātāḥ sañjalpaṃ kartum ārabdhāḥ /
analyzed: saha darśanāt ca prasāda jātāḥ sañjalpam kartum ārabdhāḥ
translated: And upon seeing him, they were filled with faith and began to discuss:

analyzed: bhavantaḥ smābhiḥ asya sakāśe pravrajitavyam iti
translated: Sirs, we should go forth in his presence.

original: teṣām evaṃ kṛtasaṅketānāṃ kecin mahāsamudram avatīrṇāh /
analyzed: teṣām evam kṛta saṅketānām kecid mahā samudram avatīrṇāḥ āh
translated: Of those who made this agreement, some entered the great ocean,

analyzed: kecid deśa antaram gatāḥ
translated: some went to other countries,

analyzed: kecid kāladharmeṇa saṃyuktāḥ
translated: some were united with the dharma of time.

analyzed: ṣodaśa janāḥ pariśiṣṭāḥ
translated: Sixteen people remained.

analyzed: te kara ka
translated: They made a pact, saying:🔽We will go forth in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: cchedakaṃ parvataṃ gatvā kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya sakāśe pravrajitāḥ /
analyzed: chedakam parvatam gatvā kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya sakāśe pravrajitāḥ
translated: They went to the mountain Chhedaka and went forth in the presence of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

analyzed: te tatra dhyāna adhyayana yogena avasthitāḥ
translated: They remained there engaged in meditation, study, and yoga.

original: yāvad apareṇa samayena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sakalaṃ buddhakāryaṃ kṛtvā indhanakṣayād ivāgniḥ ṛṣivadane mṛgadāve nirupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau
analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sakalam buddha kāryam kṛtvā indhana kṣayāt iva agniḥ ṛṣi vadane mṛga dāve nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau
translated: Then, at another time, the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, having accomplished all the duties of a Buddha, like a fire at the exhaustion of its fuel, in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana, in the nirvāṇa realm without remainder,

analyzed: teṣām devatābhiḥ ārocitam
translated: The gods announced to them:

analyzed: bhavantaḥ kāśyapaḥ parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: Sirs, Kāśyapa has passed into parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: sapta aha parinirvṛtasya ca asya śāsanam antarhitam
translated: Seven days after his parinirvāṇa, his teaching disappeared.

analyzed: kim yūyam a phala kaṃbukā puratas tiṣṭhate iti
translated: Why do you stand here like fruitless bamboo trees?

analyzed: te śrutvā akṛta kārya tvāt mahatā duḥkhena abhyāhatāḥ ah
translated: Hearing that, they were overwhelmed by great sorrow because their task was not accomplished.

original: pañca sahaśravaṇād eva karakacchedakāt parvatād avatīrya vārāṇasīṃ praviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: pañca saha śravaṇāt eva karakacchedakāt parvatāt avatīrya vārāṇasīm praviṣṭāḥ
translated: Five of them, having heard that, descended from the mountain Karaka-cchedaka and entered Vārāṇasī.

original: ṣaḍbhis tenaiva saṃvegena vīryam avalambya pratyekabodhiḥ sākṣātkṛtā /
analyzed: ṣaḍbhiḥ tena eva saṃvegena vīryam avalambya pratyeka bodhiḥ sākṣātkṛtā
translated: Six of them, by that very shock, took up diligence and directly realized individual enlightenment.

original: pañca paścād avatīrya vārāṇasīṃ praveṣṭum SBV II
analyzed: pañca paścāt avatīrya vārāṇasīm praveṣṭum
translated: Five of them, having descended later, entered Vārāṇasī.

analyzed: ārabdhāḥ yāvat śakaṭa sārthaḥ nirgacchati
translated: They set out, and the caravan of carts went out.

analyzed: ekasya śākaṭikasya balīvardāḥ durbalāḥ
translated: One of the cart drivers had weak oxen.

analyzed: sa tān pratoda yaṣṭyā bhūyas tāḍayati
translated: He repeatedly beat them with his whip and staff.

analyzed: durbala prāṇa tvāt na śaknuvanti gantum
translated: Because they were weak, they were unable to go.

original: sa ca śākaṭikas tasya śakaṭasārthasyāgrato yāyī /
analyzed: sa ca śākaṭikaḥ tasya śakaṭa sārthasya agratas yāyī
translated: And that cart driver went ahead of that caravan of carts.

analyzed: sa taiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ uktaḥ
translated: He was told by those monks,

analyzed: bhoḥ śākaṭika tava ime balīvardāḥ durbalāḥ
translated: Hey, cart driver, these oxen of yours are weak.

analyzed: kim etān pratoda yaṣṭyā bhūyas bhūyas tāḍayasi
translated: Why do you repeatedly beat them with your whip and staff?

analyzed: yadi na śaknuvanti gantum
translated: If they are unable to go,

analyzed: visrabdha gati pracāra tayā pṛṣṭhatas nugaccha iti
translated: you should follow behind them, going at a relaxed pace.

analyzed: sa kathayati
translated: He said,

original: mamāgrato gacchato na śakyam anena śakaṭasārthena sārdhaṃ gantum /
analyzed: mama agratas gacchataḥ na śakyam anena śakaṭa sārthena sārdham gantum
translated: If I go ahead, it is not possible for me to go with this caravan of carts.

analyzed: yadi aham pṛṣṭhatas nugacchāmi
translated: If I follow behind,

analyzed: nūnam ayam chorayitvā gacchati iti
translated: this caravan of carts will surely leave me behind and go on.

analyzed: te śākaṭikasya antike asat vikalpa saṃjñanita vaimukhyāḥ parasparam kathayanti
translated: Those monks, having a wrong conception of the cart driver, turned away from him and said to each other,

original: bhavantaḥ kāśyape samyaksaṃbuddhe parinirvṛte vayaṃ vilambitā ity anenāsmākam eṣā codanā kṛtā /
analyzed: bhavantaḥ kāśyape samyaksaṃbuddhe parinirvṛte vayam vilambitāḥ iti anena asmākam eṣā codanā kṛtā
translated: You have been slow in the complete nirvana of the Perfectly Awakened One Kashyapa, and with this they admonished us.

analyzed: yat nu vayam vīryam ārabhemahi
translated: Let us now exert ourselves.

analyzed: iti viditvā gāthām bhāṣante
translated: Having understood this, they spoke a verse:

original: yady apy antarhito dharmaḥ kāśyapasya mahāmuneḥ /
analyzed: yadi api antarhitaḥ dharmaḥ kāśyapasya mahā muneḥ
translated: Even though the Dharma of the great sage Kashyapa has disappeared,

analyzed: vīryam na sraṃsayiṣyāmaḥ samyaksaṃbuddha deśitam
translated: we will not let go of the effort taught by the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: parikṣayaṃ na yāsyanti yady apy asmākam āsrāvāḥ /
analyzed: parikṣayam na yāsyanti yadi api asmākam āsrāvāḥ
translated: Even if our defilements do not come to an end,

analyzed: śrāvaka agrāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ śākyasiṃhasya tāyinaḥ iti
translated: we will become the foremost disciples of the Shakyamuni, the Protector.

original: te vārāṇasīṃ praviśya piṇḍapātaṃ caritvā punar api karakacchedakaṃ parvataṃ gatvā dhyānādhyayanayogenāvasthitāḥ /
analyzed: te vārāṇasīm praviśya piṇḍapātam caritvā punar api karakacchedakam parvatam gatvā dhyāna adhyayana yogena avasthitāḥ
translated: Having entered Varanasi and gone for alms, they again went to the Karakavriksh mountain and remained there in meditation, study, and yoga.

analyzed: teṣām catvāraḥ kālagatāḥ
translated: Four of them died.

analyzed: ekaḥ vasthitaḥ
translated: One remained.

analyzed: saḥ utsukaḥ udānam udānayati
translated: He, being anxious, uttered a solemn utterance:

original: ayam eva sa karakacchedakaḥ parvato yatra mayā kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ paryupāsitaḥ /
analyzed: ayam eva sa karakacchedakaḥ parvataḥ yatra mayā kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ paryupāsitaḥ
translated: This is that very Karakavriksh mountain where I attended on the Perfectly Awakened One Kashyapa,

original: dṛṣṭaś ca tasya viṃśatibhikṣusaharāṇām ekaḥ A
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ ca tasya viṃśati bhikṣu saharāṇām ekaḥ
translated: and saw one of his twenty thousand arhats.

analyzed: sakala jambūdvīpe saṅghāṭī dhvaja dhārī iti
translated: In the entire Jambudvīpa, he was the one who bore the flag of the saṃghāṭī robe.

analyzed: sa praṇidhānam kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: He began to make a vow:

original: yan mayā bhagavati kāśyape samyaksaṃbuddhe yāvadāyur brahmacaryaṃ caritam /
analyzed: yat mayā bhagavati kāśyape samyaksaṃbuddhe yāvadāyus brahmacaryam caritam
translated: For as long as I lived, I practiced celibacy in the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened Kāśyapa.

analyzed: na kaścid guṇa gaṇaḥ dhigataḥ
translated: But I did not attain any multitude of virtues.

original: anenāhaṃ kuśalamūlena yo 'sau bhagavatā kāśyapena samyaksaṃbuddhena uttaro nāma māṇavo vyākṛtaḥ /
analyzed: anena aham kuśala mūlena yaḥ sau bhagavatā kāśyapena samyaksaṃbuddhena uttaraḥ nāma māṇavaḥ vyākṛtaḥ
translated: By this wholesome root, may I, in the teaching of that Blessed One Kāśyapa, the Perfectly Awakened One, who has declared the young brahmin named Uttara:

original: bhaviṣyasi tvaṃ māṇava varṣaśatāyuṣi prajāyāṃ śākyamunir nāma tathāgataḥ arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iti /
analyzed: bhaviṣyasi tvam māṇava varṣa śata āyuṣi prajāyām śākyamuniḥ nāma tathāgataḥ arhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iti
translated: 'Young brahmin, when the lifespan of beings is one hundred years, you will become the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One named Śākyamuni,'

original: tasyāhaṃ śāsane pravrajya tatprathamataḥ sarvakleśaprahāṇād arhatvaṃ sākṣātkuryām /
analyzed: tasya aham śāsane pravrajya tad prathamatas sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkuryām
translated: first go forth and directly realize arhatship through the complete abandonment of all defilements.

original: māṃ ca bhagavān śākyamuniḥ saṅghāṭīdhvajadhāriṇām agraṃ nirdiśed iti /
analyzed: mām ca bhagavān śākyamuniḥ saṅghāṭī dhvaja dhāriṇām agram nirdiśet iti
translated: And may the Blessed One Śākyamuni declare me the foremost of those who bear the flag of the saṃghāṭī robe.

analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ
translated: What do you think, monks?

original: yo 'sau tena kālena samayena bhagavataḥ kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya viṃśatibhikṣusaharāṇām SBV II
analyzed: yaḥ sau tena kālena samayena bhagavataḥ kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya viṃśati bhikṣu saharāṇām
translated: At that time, in the dispensation of the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened Kāśyapa, who had attained final nirvāṇa, there were twenty thousand monks who had attained the fruit of arhatship.

analyzed: sakala jambūdvīpe ekaḥ bhikṣuḥ avaśiṣṭaḥ saṅghāṭī dhvaja dhārī
translated: In the entire Jambudvīpa, only one monk remained, wearing the robe of the Saṅgha.

analyzed: yena tat karaka chedake parvate praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: He made a vow on that mountain where his hand was cut off.

analyzed: eṣaḥ eva asau kauṇḍinyaḥ bhikṣuḥ
translated: This monk Kauṇḍinya is none other than that one.

original: tatpraṇidhānvaśād etarhi bhagavatā saṅghāṭīdhvajadhāriṇām agratāyāṃ nirdiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tad praṇidhāna vaśāt etarhi bhagavatā saṅghāṭī dhvaja dhāriṇām agra tāyām nirdiṣṭaḥ
translated: By the power of that vow, he has now been designated by the Blessed One as the foremost of those who wear the robe of the Saṅgha.

original: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ ekāntakṛṣṇānāṃ karmaṇām ekāntakṛṣṇo vipākaḥ /🔽ekāntaśuklānām ekāntaśuklaḥ /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇānām karmaṇām ekānta kṛṣṇaḥ vipākaḥ  ekānta śuklānām ekānta śuklaḥ
translated: Thus, monks, the ripening of entirely dark actions is entirely dark,🔽the ripening of entirely bright actions is entirely bright,

analyzed: vyatimiśrāṇām vyatimiśraḥ
translated: and the ripening of mixed actions is mixed.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ekāntakṛṣṇāni karmāṇy apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇāni karmāṇi apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca
translated: Therefore, monks, having abandoned entirely dark actions and mixed actions,

analyzed: ekānta śukleṣu eva karmasu ābhogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: you should apply yourselves to entirely bright actions alone.

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

original: yadā bhagavatā āyuṣmataḥ kauṇḍinyasya ākāryākārya dharmo deśitaḥ /
analyzed: yadā bhagavatā āyuṣmataḥ kauṇḍinyasya ākārya ākārya dharmaḥ deśitaḥ
translated: When the Blessed One had instructed the Venerable Kauṇḍinya in the Dharma to be practiced and not practiced,

analyzed: ājñātaḥ te kauṇḍinya dharmaḥ
translated: Kauṇḍinya, the Dharma has been understood by you.

analyzed: ājñataḥ bhagavan
translated: Yes, Blessed One, the Dharma has been understood by me.

analyzed: ājñataḥ te kauṇḍinya dharmaḥ
translated: Kauṇḍinya, the Dharma has been understood by you.

analyzed: ājñataḥ sugataḥ iti
translated: Yes, Sugata, the Dharma has been understood by me.

original: tadā bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātaḥ sarvasaṃśayachettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /

original: kuśalā bhavanti bodhisatvās teṣu teṣu śilpasthānakarmasthāneṣu /
analyzed: kuśalāḥ bhavanti bodhisatvāḥ teṣu teṣu śilpasthāna karmasthāneṣu
translated: Bodhisattvas are skilled in various crafts, arts, and occupations.

original: tena svayam eva paṃcasu gātreṣu śāstranipātaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tena svayam eva paṃcasu gātreṣu śāstra nipātaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: So he himself had a knife applied to five places on his body.

original: tataḥ svarudhireṇa saṃtarpya teṣāṃ tādṛśī dharmadeśanā kṛtā yāṃ śrutvā te yakṣā paṃcasu vratapadeṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: tatas sva rudhireṇa saṃtarpya teṣām tādṛśī dharma deśanā kṛtā yām śrutvā te paṃcasu vrata padeṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: Then, having satisfied them with his own blood, he gave them such a Dharma teaching that those yakshas were established in the five precepts.

analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ
translated: What do you think, monks?

original: yo 'sau maitrabalo nāma rājā 'bhūd aham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena /
analyzed: yaḥ sau maitrabalaḥ nāma rājā bhūt aham eva sa tena kālena tena samayena
translated: The one who was the king named Maitribala at that time, on that occasion, am he.

original: ye te paṃca ojohārās yakṣā A
analyzed: ye te paṃca ojaḥ hārāḥ yakṣāḥ a
translated: Those five yakshas who took away vital force

analyzed: ete eva te paṃcakāḥ bhikṣavaḥ
translated: are none other than these five monks.

original: tadāpy ete mayā svarudhireṇa saṃtarpya paṃcasu vratapadeṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ /
analyzed: tadā api ete mayā sva rudhireṇa saṃtarpya paṃcasu vrata padeṣu pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: Then too, having satisfied them with my own blood, I established them in the five precepts.

original: etarhy apy ete mayā saddharmarasena saṃtarpitāḥ saṃsārakāntārād uttāryātyantaniṣṭhe yogakṣeme nirvāṇe pratiṣṭhāpitā /
analyzed: etarhi api ete mayā saddharma rasena saṃtarpitāḥ saṃsāra kāntārāt uttārya atyanta niṣṭhe yogakṣeme nirvāṇe pratiṣṭhāpitā
translated: Now too have I satisfied them with the nectar of the true Dharma, delivered them from the wilderness of cyclic existence, and established them in the ultimate, supreme welfare of nirvana.

analyzed: yadā bhagavatā ṣaṣ varṣāṇi duṣkaram caritam
translated: When the Blessed One practiced austerities for six years,

analyzed: anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā
translated: attained unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: vārāṇasyām gatvā dharma cakram pravartitam
translated: went to Varanasi, and turned the wheel of Dharma,

analyzed: paṃcakāḥ vinīta upapaṃcakāḥ ṣaṣṭi bhadravargīyāḥ pūgāḥ
translated: the five [disciples], the group of five, and the group of sixty good men were disciplined.

analyzed: bhikṣu bahu tvam jātam
translated: A large number of monks came to be.

original: tadā bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: tadā bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: Then the monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha who removes all doubts:

original: paśya bhadanta bhagavatā karma kṛtaṃ yasya karmaṇo vipākena ṣaḍvarṣāṇi duṣkaraṃ caritam /
analyzed: paśya bhadanta bhagavatā karma kṛtam yasya karmaṇaḥ vipākena ṣaṣ varṣāṇi duṣkaram caritam
translated: Venerable sir, see the karma that was done by the Blessed One, the ripening of which was that he practiced austerities for six years.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathāgatenaivaitāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāni pūrvavad yāvat phalanti khalu dehinām / SBV II
analyzed: tathāgatena eva etāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāni pūrvavat yāvat phalanti khalu dehinām sbv iii
translated: Monks, these karmas were created and accumulated by the Tathagata himself in other births in the past, when he was a bodhisattva, before his full enlightenment. The conditions were gathered, as before, and the karmas ripened for embodied beings.

original: The story of Nandapāla the Potter Ghaṭīkarasutta / MN / cf / MV I /
analyzed: the story of nandapāla the potter ghaṭīkarasutta
translated: The story of the potter Nandapala

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo vaibhiḍiṅgī nāma grāmanigamo 'bhūd ṛddhaś ca sphītaś ca bahujanamanuṣyaś ca /🔽vaibhiḍiṅgyāṃ bhikṣavo grāmanigame nyagrodho nāma brāhmaṇamahāśālaḥ prativasati /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ vaibhiḍiṅgī nāma grāma nigamaḥ bhūt ṛddhaḥ ca sphītaḥ ca bahu jana manuṣyaḥ ca  vaibhiḍiṅgyām bhikṣavaḥ grāma nigame nyagrodhaḥ nāma brāhmaṇa mahā śālaḥ prativasati
translated: Once upon a time, monks, there was a village named Vaibidīṅgī, prosperous, busy, crowded, with plenty of food,

analyzed: āḍhyaḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ sphītaḥ
translated: In the village of Vaibidīṅgī, monks, there lived a wealthy, rich, and prosperous brāhmaṇa named Nyagrodha,

original: vaibhiḍiṅgīṃ paribhuṃkte sotsadāṃ satṛṇakāṣṭhodakāṃ kṛkinā rājñā brahmadeyāṃ dattām /
analyzed: vaibhiḍiṅgīm paribhuṃkte sa utsadām sa tṛṇa kāṣṭha udakām kṛkinā rājñā brahma deyām dattām
translated: who enjoyed the use of Vaibidīṅgī with its villages, fields, and forests, given to him by King Kiki as a brahma-grant.

original: nyagrodhasya khalu bhikṣavo brāhmaṇamahaśālasya uttaro nāmo māṇavo 'ntevāsī upeto🔽mātṛtaḥ pitṛtaḥ saṃśuddho gṛhiṇyām anākṣipto jātivādena gotravādena ca yāvad āsaptamaṃ
analyzed: nyagrodhasya khalu bhikṣavaḥ brāhmaṇamahaśālasya uttaraḥ nāma māṇavaḥ ntevāsī  mātṛtaḥ pitṛtaḥ saṃśuddhaḥ gṛhiṇyām an ākṣiptaḥ jāti vādena gotra vādena ca yāvat āsaptamam
translated: Now, monks, the wealthy brāhmaṇa Nyagrodha had a student named Uttara,

analyzed: mātāmaha paitāmaham yugam upādāya
translated: who was pure in terms of his mother, pure in terms of his father, pure in terms of his birth, pure in terms of his lineage, up to seven generations,🔽without reproach in terms of his caste,

original: adhyāpako mantradharo trayāṇāṃ vedānāṃ pāraṃgataḥ sanighaṇṭukaiṭabhānāṃ sākṣaraprabhedānām itihāsapaṃcamānāṃ sādṛśo vyākarakaḥ /
analyzed: adhyāpakaḥ trayāṇām vedānām pāraṃgataḥ sa nighaṇṭu kaiṭabhānām sa akṣara prabhedānām itihāsa paṃcamānām sādṛśaḥ vyākarakaḥ
translated: a teacher, a master of the Vedas, who had mastered the three Vedas with their vocabularies, ritual, phonology, and histories as the fifth, and was skilled in philology and grammar.

analyzed: abhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ
translated: He was handsome, good-looking, and pleasing to the eye.

original: nyagrodhasya brāhmaṇamahaśālasya paṃcamātrāṇi māṇavakaśatāni brāhmaṇakān mantrān vācayanti /
analyzed: nyagrodhasya brāhmaṇa maha śālasya paṃca mātrāṇi māṇavaka śatāni brāhmaṇakān mantrān vācayanti
translated: There were five hundred young brahmins who were studying the mantras of the great brāhmaṇa Nyagrodha.

original: vaibhiḍiṅgyāṃ bhikṣavo grāmanigame nandīpālo ghaṭīkaraḥ prativasati /🔽buddhe 'bhiprasanno dharme saṃghe 'bhiprasannaḥ /
analyzed: vaibhiḍiṅgyām bhikṣavaḥ grāma nigame nandīpālaḥ ghaṭī karaḥ prativasati  buddhe bhiprasannaḥ dharme saṃghe bhiprasannaḥ
translated: Monks, in the village and town of Vaibhidīṃgi, there lived a potter named Nāndīpāla.🔽He had faith in the Buddha, faith in the Dharma, and faith in the Saṅgha.

original: buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saṃghaṃ śaraṇaṃ gataḥ /🔽buddhe ekāntiko dharme saṃghe ekāntikaḥ /
analyzed: buddham śaraṇam gataḥ dhammam saṃgham śaraṇam gataḥ  buddhe ekāntikaḥ dharme saṃghe ekāntikaḥ
translated: He had gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽He was exclusively devoted to the Buddha, exclusively devoted to the Dharma, and exclusively devoted to the Saṅgha.

original: buddhe niṣkāṃkṣo nirvicikitso dharme saṃghe niṣkāṃkṣo nirvicitaḥ /
analyzed: buddhe niṣkāṃkṣaḥ nirvicikitsaḥ dharme saṃghe niṣkāṃkṣaḥ nirvicitaḥ
translated: He had no doubts or uncertainties about the Buddha, the Dharma, or the Saṅgha.

original: duḥkhe samudaye nirodhe mārge niṣkāṃkṣo nirvicikitso dṛṣṭasatya āgataphalābhisamitavāṃ nikṣiptaparṇamusalo na svahastaṃ pṛthivīṃ khanati na
analyzed: duḥkhe samudaye nirodhe mārge niṣkāṃkṣaḥ nirvicikitsaḥ dṛṣṭa satyaḥ āgata phala abhisamitavān nikṣipta parṇa musalaḥ na sva hastam pṛthivīm khanati na
translated: He had seen the truths, attained the fruits, and realized the goal. He had laid aside the wooden bowl and the hoe, and did not dig the earth with his own hands🔽or have others dig it, except

analyzed: khānayati na anyatra
translated: He digs, not elsewhere.

original: yat tad bhavati dakaprarugnaṃ vā mūṣikotkirā vā tataḥ kāyena mṛttikāṃ saṃhṛtya niṣprāṇakenodakena tīmayitvā bhājanāni kṛtvā ekāntam upanikṣipya
analyzed: yat tat bhavati daka prarugnam vā mūṣika utkirā vā tatas kāyena mṛttikām saṃhṛtya niṣprāṇakena udakena tīmayitvā bhājanāni kṛtvā ekāntam upanikṣipya
translated: Whatever is there, whether damaged by water or gnawed by mice, from that he collects clay with his body, mixes it with water free from living organisms, makes vessels, and places them in a secluded place.

analyzed: evam āha
translated: He says this:

original: eta āryā eta bhadramukhā tilān vā taṇḍulān vā mudgaprabhṛtīn vā māṣaprabhṛtīn vā ekānta upanikṣipya yo vā yena bhājanenārthī sa tad ādāya prakrāmatu
analyzed: ete āryāḥ eta bhadra mukhāḥ tilān vā taṇḍulān vā mudga prabhṛtīn vā māṣa prabhṛtīn vā ekānte upanikṣipya yaḥ vā yena bhājanena arthī sa tat ādāya prakrāmatu
translated: These noble ones, these good faces, having placed sesame seeds, rice, mung beans, etc., or beans, etc., in a secluded place, whoever needs which vessel, let him take it and leave.

original: sa tasmād andhau mātāpitarau bibharti /🔽kāśyapaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ kālena SBV II
analyzed: sa tasmāt andhau mātā pitarau bibharti  kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham kālena sbv
translated: He supports his blind mother and father from that.

analyzed: kālam piṇḍakena pratipādayati
translated: He offers alms to the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa at the proper time.

original: uttarasya māṇavasya mitraṃ suhṛd vayasyako ca nandīpālo ghaṭīkaro yena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: uttarasya māṇavasya mitram suhṛd ca nandīpālaḥ ghaṭī karaḥ yena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: The potter Nandīpāla, a friend, well-wisher, and companion of the young brāhmaṇa Uttara, approached the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: upasaṃkramya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekāntaniṣaṇṇaḥ /🔽ekāntaniṣaṇṇaṃ A
analyzed: upasaṃkramya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānta niṣaṇṇaḥ 🔽ekānta niṣaṇṇam
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa and sat down to one side.🔽To the one sitting to one side, the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, knowing his thoughts, inclinations, nature, and temperament, gave a discourse on the dharma that was pleasing and delightful, and then became silent.

original: nandīpālaṃ ghaṭīkaraṃ kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati /
analyzed: nandīpālam ghaṭīkaram kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa instructed, inspired, roused, and delighted the potter Nandīpāla with a talk on the Dharma.

original: anekaparyāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm /
analyzed: aneka paryāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm
translated: Having instructed, inspired, roused, and delighted him with a talk on the Dharma in many ways, he remained silent.

original: atha nandīpālo ghaṭīkaraḥ kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā utthāyāsanāt prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha nandīpālaḥ ghaṭī karaḥ kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā utthāya āsanāt prakrāntaḥ
translated: Then the potter Nandīpāla, having bowed his head at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, rose from his seat and departed.

original: tena khalu samayena uttaro māṇavaḥ sarvaśvetaṃ vaḍavāratham abhiruhya sauvarṇena daṇḍakamaṇḍalunā dhāryamānena māṇavakagaṇaparivṛto māṇavakagaṇapuraskṛto
analyzed: tena khalu samayena uttaraḥ māṇavaḥ sarva śvetam vaḍavā ratham abhiruhya sauvarṇena daṇḍa kamaṇḍalunā dhāryamānena māṇavaka gaṇa parivṛtaḥ māṇavaka gaṇa puraskṛtaḥ
translated: At that time, the young brahmin Uttara, having mounted a chariot with a white horse, holding a golden staff and water pot, surrounded by a group of young brahmins, with a group of young brahmins in front of him,

analyzed: vaibhiḍiṅgyāt niryāti
translated: was leaving Vaibhiḍiṅgī.

original: bahir vaibhiḍiṅgyāḥ brāhmaṇakān mantrān vācayitukāmaḥ adrākṣīd uttaro māṇavo nandīpālaṃ ghaṭīkaraṃ dūrād eva /
analyzed: bahis vaibhiḍiṅgyāḥ brāhmaṇakān mantrān vācayitu kāmaḥ adrākṣīt uttaraḥ māṇavaḥ nandīpālam ghaṭīkaram dūrāt eva
translated: Desiring to recite the brahminical mantras outside of Vaibhiḍiṅgī, the young brahmin Uttara saw the potter Nandīpāla from a distance.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar evam āha
translated: And having seen him, he said this:

original: kutas tvaṃ somya nandīpāla etarhy āgacchasi /
analyzed: kutas tvam somya nandīpālaḥ etarhi āgacchasi
translated: From where are you coming, my dear Nandīpāla, at this time?

original: ito 'haṃ somya uttara etarhy āgacchāmi kāśyapaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ paryupāsya /
analyzed: itas ham somyaḥ uttaraḥ etarhi āgacchāmi kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham paryupāsya
translated: From here, my dear, I will come back after attending on the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

analyzed: ehi āvām somya uttara gamiṣyāvāḥ
translated: Come, my dear Uttarā, let us go.

analyzed: kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham paryupāsiṣyāvahe
translated: We will attend on the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: alaṃ somya nandīpāla kāśyapena samyaksaṃbuddhena dṛṣṭenālaṃ paryupāsitena /
analyzed: alam somya nandīpāla kāśyapena samyaksaṃbuddhena dṛṣṭena alam paryupāsitena
translated: Enough, my dear Nāndīpāla, with seeing the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, enough with attending on him.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: kutas tasmin muṇḍake śramaṇake bodhiḥ
translated: How can there be awakening in that shaven-headed ascetic?

analyzed: bodhiḥ hi parama duṣkarā
translated: Awakening is extremely difficult.

original: mā tvaṃ somya uttara evaṃ vada /
analyzed: mā tvam somyaḥ uttaraḥ evam vada
translated: Do not speak thus, my dear Uttarā.

analyzed: kutas tasmin śramaṇake bodhiḥ
translated: How can there be awakening in that ascetic?

analyzed: bodhiḥ hi parama duṣkarā
translated: Awakening is extremely difficult.

analyzed: api tu buddhaḥ sa bhagavān
translated: But he is the Buddha, the Blessed One.

analyzed: buddhāḥ ca anena sarva dharmāḥ iti
translated: And the Buddhas have all dharmas.

original: dvir api trir api nandīpālo ghaṭīkaraḥ uttaraṃ māṇavakam idam avocat /
analyzed: dvis api tris api nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ uttaram māṇavakam idam avocat
translated: Twice and thrice Nāndīpāla the potter said this to the young man Uttarā:

analyzed: ehi āvām somya uttara gamiṣyāvaḥ
translated: Come, my dear Uttarā, let us go.

analyzed: kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham paryupāsiṣyāvahe iti
translated: We will attend on the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: dvir api trir api uttaro māṇavo nandīpālaṃ ghaṭīkaram idam avoat /
analyzed: dvis api tris api uttaraḥ māṇavaḥ nandīpālam ghaṭīkaram idam avoat
translated: Twice and thrice the young man Uttarā said this to Nāndīpāla the potter:

original: alaṃ somya nandīpāla kāśyapena samyaksaṃbuddhena dṛṣṭena alaṃ paryupāsitena /
analyzed: alam somya nandīpāla kāśyapena samyaksaṃbuddhena dṛṣṭena alam paryupāsitena
translated: Enough, my dear Nāndīpāla, with seeing the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, enough with attending on him.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: kutas tasmin muṇḍale śramaṇake bodhiḥ
translated: How can there be awakening in that shaven-headed ascetic?

analyzed: bodhiḥ hi parama duṣkarā
translated: Awakening is extremely difficult.

original: mā tvaṃ somyottara evaṃ vada kutas tasmin muṇḍake śramaṇake bodhiḥ /
analyzed: mā tvam somya uttaraḥ evam vada kutas tasmin muṇḍake śramaṇake bodhiḥ
translated: My dear Uttara, do not say 'How can there be awakening in that shaven-headed ascetic?'

analyzed: bodhiḥ hi parama duṣkarā
translated: Awakening is extremely difficult.

analyzed: api tu buddhaḥ sa bhagavān
translated: Rather, he is the Buddha, the Blessed One.

analyzed: buddhāḥ ca anena sarva dharmāḥ iti
translated: And the Buddhas are all dharmas.

original: atha nandīpālo ghaṭīkara uttarasya māṇavasya ratham abhiruhya uttaraṃ māṇavam idam avocat /
analyzed: atha nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ uttarasya māṇavasya ratham abhiruhya uttaram māṇavam idam avocat
translated: Then Nāndīpāla the potter, having mounted the chariot, said this to the young man Uttara:

analyzed: ehi āvām somya uttara gamiṣyāvaḥ
translated: Come, my dear Uttara, let us go.

analyzed: kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham paryupāsiṣyāvahe iti
translated: Let us attend on the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

analyzed: atha uttarasya māṇavasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the young man Uttara:

original: na batāvaro buddho bhaviṣyati / SBV II
analyzed: na bata avaraḥ buddhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Surely the Buddha will not be inferior,

analyzed: na avaram dharma ākhyānam
translated: nor will the teaching of the Dharma be inferior.

original: yatredaṇīṃ nandīpālo ghaṭīkaro dīrgharātram acaṇḍo 'rabhaso 'karkaśa 'sāhasikaḥ keśagrahaṇam apy agamad iti viditvā nandīpālaṃ ghaṭīkaram idam🔽somya nandīpāla ato 'pi yāvat /
analyzed: yatra idaṇīm nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ dīrgharātram acaṇḍaḥ karkaśa sāhasikaḥ keśa grahaṇam api agamat iti viditvā nandīpālam ghaṭīkaram idam  somya nandīpāla atas pi yāvat
translated: Knowing that the potter Nandīpāla had for a long time been free from anger, harshness, irritability, and rashness, and had even endured having his hair pulled, he said this to the potter Nandīpāla:🔽Nandīpāla, my dear, it is from here on.

analyzed: somya uttara
translated: My dear, it is from here on.

analyzed: a taḥ pi yāvat

translated: We will attend on the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.🔽Then the young man Uttara and the potter Nandīpāla, having mounted a chariot, approached the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: tayor yāvatī yānasya bhūmis tāvad yānena gatvā yānād avatīrya yena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhas tenopasaṃkrāntau /
analyzed: tayoḥ yāvatī yānasya bhūmiḥ tāvat yānena gatvā yānāt avatīrya yena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntau
translated: Having gone by chariot as far as the ground was passable for a chariot, they got down from the chariot, and approached the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: upasaṃkramya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇau /

translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa and sat down to one side.

analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇaḥ nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham idam avocat
translated: Seated to one side, the potter Nandīpāla said this to the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa:

analyzed: ayam bhadanta uttaraḥ
translated: Venerable Sir, this young brahmin Uttara

original: sādhv asya bhagavān tathā dharmaṃ deśayed yathā uttaro māṇavo buddhe 'bhiprasīded dharme saṃghe 'bhiprasīded iti /🔽adhivāsayati kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddha uttaraṃ māṇavaṃ dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati /
analyzed: sādhu asya bhagavān tathā dharmam deśayet yathā uttaraḥ māṇavaḥ buddhe bhiprasīdet dharme saṃghe bhiprasīdet iti  adhivāsayati kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ uttaram māṇavam dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One would teach the Dharma to him in such a way that the young brahmin Uttara would have faith in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽The Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa accepted the young brahmin Uttara, and after instructing, inspiring, and gladdening him with a talk on the Dharma, he remained silent.

original: anekaparyāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm /
analyzed: aneka paryāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm
translated: Then the young brahmin Uttara, after instructing, inspiring, and gladdening the potter Nandīpāla with a talk on the Dharma, remained silent.

original: athottaro māṇavo nandīpālaṃ ghaṭīkaram idam avocat /🔽kasmāt tvaṃ /
analyzed: atha uttaraḥ māṇavaḥ nandīpālam ghaṭīkaram idam avocat  kasmāt tvam
translated: Then the young brahmin Uttara said this to the potter Nandīpāla:🔽Why is it, my dear Nandīpāla,

analyzed: somya nandīpāla
translated: that you,

analyzed: su ākhyātam dharma vinayam śrutvā na pravrajasi samyak eva śraddhayā agārāt anāgārikām
translated: having heard the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, do not go forth from home to homelessness with true faith?

analyzed: na tvam somya kumāra
translated: You, my dear young man,

analyzed: jānīṣe yathā aham andham mātā pitaram bibharmi
translated: You know how I support my blind parents,

analyzed: kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham kālena ca kālam piṇḍakena pratipādayāmi
translated: and offer alms to the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa in a timely manner.

original: pravraja tvaṃ somya nandīpāla mā vā /
analyzed: pravraja tvam somya nandī pāla mā vā
translated: Either go forth, dear Nāndīpāla, or don't.

analyzed: aham tāvat pravrajiṣye iti
translated: I will go forth, for now.

analyzed: atha nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham idam avocat
translated: Then the potter Nāndīpāla said this to the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa:

original: ayaṃ bhadanta uttaro māṇava ākāṃkṣati svākhyāte dharmavinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadaṃ bhikṣubhāvam /
analyzed: ayam bhadantaḥ uttaraḥ māṇavaḥ ākāṃkṣati su ākhyāte dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadam bhikṣu bhāvam
translated: Venerable one, this young brahmin Uttara desires to go forth and be ordained as a monk in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: taṃ bhagavān pravrājayatūpasaṃpādayatu anukaṃpām upādāya iti /
analyzed: tam bhagavān pravrājayatu upasaṃpādayatu anukaṃpām upādāya iti
translated: May the Blessed One allow his going forth and ordination, out of compassion.

original: adhivāsayati kāśyapaḥ SBV II 🔽samyaksaṃbuddho nandīpālasya ghaṭīkarasya tūṣṇīṃbhāvena /
analyzed: adhivāsayati kāśyapaḥ sbu ii  samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ nandīpālasya ghaṭīkarasya tūṣṇīṃbhāvena
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa🔽assented to the potter Nāndīpāla by remaining silent.

original: atha nandīpālo ghaṭīkaraḥ kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tūṣṇīṃbhāvenādhivāsanāṃ viditvā kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvotthāyāsanāt
analyzed: atha nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tūṣṇīṃbhāvena adhivāsanām viditvā kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā utthāya āsanāt
translated: Then the potter Nāndīpāla, understanding that the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa had assented by remaining silent, bowed his head at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, rose from his seat,

original: atha kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaś aciraprakrāntaṃ nandīpālaṃ ghaṭīkaraṃ viditvā uttaraṃ
analyzed: atha kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ acira prakrāntam nandīpālam ghaṭī karam viditvā uttaram
translated: Then the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, knowing that the potter Nandīpāla had gone away for a while, ordained the young man Uttara

original: māṇavaṃ pravrājya upasaṃpādya yathābhiramyaṃ vaibhiḍiṃgyāṃ vihṛtya yena vārāṇasī
analyzed: māṇavam pravrājya upasaṃpādya yathā abhiramyam vaibhiḍiṃgyām vihṛtya yena vārāṇasī
translated: and having stayed in Vaibhīḍiṅga as long as he liked, he went on a journey to Vārāṇasī,

analyzed: kāśīnām nigamaḥ tena cārikām prakrāntaḥ
translated: the city of the Kāśīs.

analyzed: anupūrveṇa cārikām caran vārāṇasīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: Wandering in stages, he arrived at Vārāṇasī.

analyzed: vārāṇasyām viharati ṛṣivadane mṛgadāve
translated: He stayed in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana near Vārāṇasī.

original: aśrauṣīt kṛkī rājā kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ kāśiṣu janapade cārikāṃ caran vārāṇasīm anuprāpto vārāṇasyāṃ viharati ṛṣivadane mṛgadāve iti /
analyzed: aśrauṣīt kṛkī rājā kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ kāśiṣu janapade cārikām caran vārāṇasīm anuprāptaḥ vārāṇasyām viharati ṛṣivadane mṛgadāve iti
translated: King Kṛkī heard that the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, wandering in the Kāśi country, had arrived at Vārāṇasī and was staying in the Deer Park at Ṛṣivadana near Vārāṇasī.

original: śrutvā ca punar vārāṇasyāḥ niṣkramya yena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar vārāṇasyāḥ niṣkramya yena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Having heard this, he left Vārāṇasī and went to where the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa was.

original: upasaṃkramya upasaṃkramya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇau /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya upasaṃkramya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇau
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa and sat down to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇaṃ kṛkiṃ rājānaṃ kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddho dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇam kṛkim rājānam kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati
translated: When King Kṛkī was seated to one side, the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted him with a discourse on the Dharma.

original: anekaparyāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm /
analyzed: aneka paryāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm
translated: Having instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted him in various ways with a discourse on the Dharma, he remained silent.

original: atha kṛkī rājā utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṃgaṃ kṛtvā yena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya kāśyapam idam avocat /
analyzed: atha kṛkī rājā utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṃgam kṛtvā yena kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena añjalim praṇamya kāśyapam idam avocat
translated: Then King Kṛkī rose from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, bowed his head at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, and said this to Kāśyapa:

original: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān śvo 'ntargṛhe bhaktena sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghena iti /🔽adhivāsayati kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ kṛkino rājñas tūṣṇīṃbhāvena /
analyzed: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān śvas ntargṛhe bhaktena sārdham bhikṣu saṃghena iti  adhivāsayati kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ kṛkinaḥ rājñaḥ tūṣṇīṃbhāvena
translated: May the Blessed One consent to my offering of a meal tomorrow in my house, together with the community of monks.🔽The Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa assented to King Kṛkī by remaining silent.

original: atha kṛkī rājā kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tūṣṇīṃbhāvenādhivāsanāṃ viditvā kāsyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvotthāyāsanāt
analyzed: atha kṛkī rājā kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tūṣṇīṃbhāvena adhivāsanām viditvā kāsyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā utthāya āsanāt
translated: Then King Kṛkī, understanding that the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa had assented by remaining silent, bowed his head at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, rose from his seat,

original: atha kṛkī rājā tām eva rātriṃ śuci praṇītaṃ khādanīyabhojanīyaṃ samudānīya kālyam evotthāyāsanakāni prajñapya udakamaṇiṃ pratiṣṭhāpya A
analyzed: atha kṛkiḥ rājā tām eva rātrim śuci praṇītam khādanīya bhojanīyam samudānīya kālyam eva utthāya āsanakāni prajñapya udaka maṇim pratiṣṭhāpya a
translated: Then King Kṛkī, having prepared a pure and fine meal during that night, rose early, had seats arranged, set out a water vessel,

analyzed: kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya dūtena kālam ārocayati
translated: and sent a messenger to inform the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa of the time:

original: samayo bhadanta sajjaṃ bhaktaṃ yasyedānīṃ bhagavān kālaṃ manyate iti /
analyzed: samayaḥ bhadanta sajjam bhaktam yasya idānīm bhagavān kālam manyate iti
translated: Venerable one, the time is right. The meal is ready. Now it is up to the Blessed One to do as he sees fit.

original: atha kāsyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya bhikṣugaṇaparivṛto bhikṣusaṃghapuraskṛto yena kṛkeḥ rājño bhaktābhisāras
analyzed: atha kāsyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya bhikṣu gaṇa parivṛtaḥ bhikṣu saṃgha puraskṛtaḥ yena kṛkeḥ rājñaḥ bhakta abhisāraḥ
translated: Then the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, having dressed in the morning, took his bowl and robe, and surrounded by a group of monks, with the community of monks in front, went to King Kṛkī's meal distribution.

original: upasaṃkramya purastād bhikṣusaṃghasya prajñapta evāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya purastāt bhikṣu saṃghasya prajñapte eva āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, he sat down on the seat arranged in front of the community of monks.

original: atha kṛkī rājā sukhopaniṣaṇṇaṃ buddhapramukhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghaṃ viditvā śucinā praṇītena khādanīyabhojanīyena svahastaṃ saṃtarpayati saṃpravārayati /
analyzed: atha kṛkī rājā sukha upaniṣaṇṇam buddha pramukham bhikṣu saṃgham viditvā śucinā praṇītena khādanīya bhojanīyena sva hastam saṃtarpayati saṃpravārayati
translated: Then King Kṛkī, knowing that the community of monks headed by the Buddha was seated in comfort, satisfied and served them with his own hands with a pure and fine meal.

original: anekaparyāyeṇa śucinā praṇītena khādanīyabhojanīyena svahastaṃ saṃtarpya saṃpravārya
analyzed: aneka paryāyeṇa śucinā praṇītena khādanīya bhojanīyena sva hastam saṃtarpya saṃpravārya
translated: Having satisfied and served them in many courses with a pure and fine meal with his own hands,

original: kāśyapaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ bhuktavantaṃ viditvā dhautahastam apanītapātraṃ sauvarṇaṃ
analyzed: kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham bhuktavantam viditvā dhauta hastam apanīta pātram sauvarṇam
translated: Knowing that the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa had finished his meal, had washed his hand and put away his bowl, he took a golden seat with his right hand,

original: bhṛṅgāram ādāya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya SBV II
analyzed: bhṛṅgāram ādāya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya
translated: Knowing that the perfectly awakened Kāśyapa had finished his meal, washed his hands and bowl, and put away his robe, he took a golden ewer

analyzed: puratas sthāt āyācamānaḥ
translated: and stood before the perfectly awakened Kāśyapa, begging.

original: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān traimāsīṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghena /
analyzed: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān traimāsīm cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ sārdham bhikṣu saṃghena
translated: May the Blessed One consent to spend the three months of the rainy season with the community of monks, together with his robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick,

analyzed: aham bhagavataḥ rthāya paṃca vihāra śatāni māpayiṣyāmi
translated: and for the Blessed One's sake I will have five hundred monasteries built.

analyzed: paṃca maṃcapīṭha vṛṣi koca va bimbopadhāna caturaśraka śatāni kārayiṣyāmi
translated: I will have five hundred beds, seats, stools, cushions, pillows, and four-sided boxes made.

original: anena caivaṃrūpena parṇopagūḍhena śālinā bhagavantaṃ upasthāsyāmi bhikṣusaṃghaṃ ca /
analyzed: anena ca evaṃrūpena parṇa upagūḍhena śālinā bhagavantam upasthāsyāmi bhikṣu saṃgham ca
translated: And with this kind of covered rice, I will serve the Blessed One and the community of monks.

original: alaṃ mahārājā kṛtam etāvad yāvad eva cittam abhiprasannam /
analyzed: alam mahā rājā kṛtam etāvat yāvat eva cittam abhiprasannam
translated: Enough, great king, this is done, as far as your mind is pleased.

original: dvir api trir api kṛkī rājā kāśyapaṃ samyaksaṃbuddham idam avocat /
analyzed: dvis api tris api kṛkī rājā kāśyapam samyaksaṃbuddham idam avocat
translated: Twice and thrice King Kṛkī said this to the perfectly awakened Kāśyapa:

original: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān traimāsīṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghena /
analyzed: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān traimāsīm cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ sārdham bhikṣu saṃghena
translated: May the Blessed One consent to spend the three months of the rainy season with me, together with the community of monks, with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

analyzed: aham bhagavataḥ rthāya paṃca vihāra śatāni māpayiṣyāmi
translated: For the Blessed One's sake, I will have five hundred monasteries built.

analyzed: paṃca maṃcapīṭha vṛṣi koca va bimbopadhāna caturaśraka śatāni kārayiṣyāmi
translated: I will have five hundred beds, five hundred benches, five hundred pots, five hundred cushions, five hundred four-cornered cloths, and five hundred round cloths made.

original: anena caivaṃrūpena parṇopagūḍhena śālinā bhagavantaṃ upasthāsyāmi bhikṣusaṃghaṃ ca /
analyzed: anena ca evaṃrūpena parṇa upagūḍhena śālinā bhagavantam upasthāsyāmi bhikṣu saṃgham ca
translated: And with this kind of covered rice, I will serve the Blessed One and the community of monks.

original: dvir api trir api kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ kṛkiṃ rājānam idam avocat /
analyzed: dvis api tris api kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ kṛkim rājānam idam avocat
translated: For the second and third time, the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa said this to King Kṛkī:

original: alaṃ mahārājā kṛtam etāvad yāvad eva cittam abhiprasannam /
analyzed: alam mahā rājā kṛtam etāvat yāvat eva cittam abhiprasannam
translated: Enough, Great King, this is enough. As far as your mind is pleased.

original: atha kṛkī rājā kāśyapaṃ saṃyaksaṃbuddham idam avocat /
analyzed: atha kṛkī rājā kāśyapam saṃyaksaṃbuddham idam avocat
translated: Then King Kṛkī said this to the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa:

original: asti kaścid bhagavan yo 'py evaṃrūpa upasthāyakaḥ tadyathā aham etarhy /
analyzed: asti kaścid bhagavan yaḥ u pi evaṃrūpaḥ upasthāyakaḥ tat yathā aham etarhi
translated: Is there, Blessed One, anyone else who is such a devoted attendant as I am now?

original: asti mahārāja tavaiva vijite vaibhiḍiṃgī nāma grāmanigamaḥ /
analyzed: asti mahā rāja tava eva vijite vaibhiḍiṃgī nāma grāma nigamaḥ
translated: Great King, in your own realm, there is a village named Vaibidīṅgī.

analyzed: tatra nandīpālaḥ nāma ghaṭīkara prativasati
translated: There lives a potter named Nāndīpāla.

analyzed: sa buddhe bhiprasannaḥ dharme saṃghe bhiprasannaḥ
translated: He is one who has confidence in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gato dhammaṃ saṃghaṃ śaraṇaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: buddham śaraṇam gataḥ dhammam saṃgham śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: He has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

analyzed: buddhe ekāntikaḥ dharme saṃghe ekāntikaḥ
translated: He is one who is exclusively devoted to the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: buddhe niṣkāṃkṣo nirvicikitso dharme saṃghe duḥkhe samudaye nirodhe mārge niṣkāṃkṣo
analyzed: buddhe niṣkāṃkṣaḥ nirvicikitsaḥ dharme saṃghe duḥkhe samudaye nirodhe mārge niṣkāṃkṣaḥ
translated: He is one who is free from doubt and perplexity regarding the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, regarding suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path,

original: nirvicikitso dṛṣṭasatye āgataphalo 'bhisamitavāṃ nikṣiptaparṇamusalaḥ sa na svahastaṃ
analyzed: nirvicikitsaḥ dṛṣṭa satye āgata phalaḥ bhisamitavān nikṣipta parṇa musalaḥ sa na sva hastam
translated: he is one who has seen the truths, attained the fruits, and realized the highest goal. He does not dig the earth himself

analyzed: pṛthivīm khanati na khānayati na anyatra
translated: or have it dug, except in these cases:

original: yat tad bhavati dakaprarugnaṃ vā mūṣikotkirā vā tataḥ kāyena mṛttikāṃ saṃhṛtya niṣprāṇakenodakena tīmayitvā bhājanāni kṛtvaikāntam upanikṣipyaivam
analyzed: yat tat bhavati daka prarugnam vā mūṣika utkirā vā tatas kāyena mṛttikām saṃhṛtya niṣprāṇakena udakena tīmayitvā bhājanāni kṛtvā ekāntam upanikṣipya evam
translated: if it has been damaged by water or by rats, he collects the earth with his own body, mixes it with water that is free from living beings, makes vessels out of it, places them in a secluded place, and says:

original: eta āryā eta bhadramukhā tilān vā taṇḍulān vā mudgaprabhṛtīn vā māṣaprabhṛtīn vā ekānta upanikṣipya yo vā yena bhājanenārthī bhavati sa tad
analyzed: ete āryāḥ eta bhadra mukhāḥ tilān vā taṇḍulān vā mudga prabhṛtīn vā māṣa prabhṛtīn vā ekānte upanikṣipya yaḥ vā yena bhājanena arthī bhavati sa tat
translated: These are the noble ones, these are the good people. They place sesame seeds, rice, mung beans, etc., or beans, etc., in a secluded place. Whoever needs which vessel,

analyzed: ādāya prakrāmatu
translated: he may take it and go.

analyzed: sa tasmāt andham mātā pitarau bibharti
translated: He supports his blind parents from that.

original: māṃ ca kālena kālaṃ piṇḍakena pratipādayati / SBV II
analyzed: mām ca kālena kālam piṇḍakena pratipādayati
translated: And he provides me with alms food from time to time.

original: ekam ahaṃ mahārāja samayaṃ vaibhiḍiṃgīṃ grāmanigamam upaniśritya viharāmi /🔽so 'haṃ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya vaibhiḍiṃgīṃ grāmanigamaṃ piṇḍāya prāvikṣam / A
analyzed: ekam aham mahā rāja samayam vaibhiḍiṃgīm grāma nigamam upaniśritya viharāmi  saḥ ham pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya vaibhiḍiṃgīm grāma nigamam piṇḍāya prāvikṣam a
translated: Great king, there was one time when I was dwelling, having taken up residence in the village town of Vaibidangī.🔽In the morning, having dressed and taking my bowl and robe, I entered the village town of Vaibidangī for alms.

original: sāvādānaṃ vaibhiḍaṃgīṃ piṇḍāya caran yena ghaṭīkarasya niveśanaṃ tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: sa avādānam vaibhiḍaṃgīm piṇḍāya caran yena ghaṭī karasya niveśanam tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Wandering for alms in Vaibidangī, I approached the dwelling of the potter.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya śanais manda mandam argaḍam ākoṭayāmi
translated: Having approached, I gently and slowly knocked on the door.

original: tena khalu samayena nandīpālo ghaṭīkaraḥ bahir nirgato 'bhūt kenacid eva karaṇīyena /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ bahis nirgataḥ bhūt kenacid eva karaṇīyena
translated: At that time, Nanda the potter had gone out for some business or other.

analyzed: aśrauṣṭām nandīpālasya ghaṭīkarasya andhau mātā pitarau argaḍasya ākoṭana śabdam
translated: Nanda the potter's blind parents heard the sound of the door being knocked.

analyzed: śrutvā ca punar evam āhatuḥ
translated: And having heard, they said this:

original: ka eṣa āryaḥ ka eṣa bhadramukhaḥ śanair mandamandam argaḍam ākoṭayati /
analyzed: kaḥ eṣaḥ āryaḥ kaḥ eṣa bhadra mukhaḥ śanais mandamandam argaḍam ākoṭayati
translated: Who is this noble one, who is this good man, gently and slowly knocking on the door?

analyzed: tau aham evam vadāmi
translated: I said this to them:

analyzed: aham kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ piṇḍakena arthī
translated: I am the perfectly awakened one Kāśyapa, seeking alms.

analyzed: tau evam āhatuḥ
translated: They said this:

original: praviśatu āryaḥ praviśatu bhadramukha ete kuṇḍālikāyāṃ kulmāṣāḥ piṭhirikāyāṃ ca sūpikam /
analyzed: praviśatu āryaḥ praviśatu bhadra mukhaḥ ete kuṇḍālikāyām kulmāṣāḥ piṭhirikāyām ca sūpikam
translated: Let the noble one enter, let the good one enter. These are the beans in the pot and the soup in the pan.

analyzed: saced ākāṃkṣasi ātmanā gṛhītvā paribhuṃkṣva
translated: If you wish, take them yourself and eat them.

analyzed: bahirgata te upasthāyakaḥ iti
translated: Your attendant has gone outside.

original: so 'haṃ mahārāja uttarakauravaṃ samayam adhiṣṭhāya svayam eva kuṇḍalikāyāḥ kulmāṣān piṭhirikāyāś ca sūpikaṃ gṛhītvā bhuktavān /
analyzed: saḥ ham mahā rāja uttara kauravam samayam adhiṣṭhāya svayam eva kuṇḍalikāyāḥ kulmāṣān piṭhirikāyāḥ ca sūpikam gṛhītvā bhuktavān
translated: I, great king, having made an agreement with the northern Kurus, took the beans from the pot and the soup from the pan myself and ate them.

analyzed: tatas paścāt āgataḥ nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ
translated: After that, the potter Nandīpāla came.

original: adrākṣīn nandīpālo ghaṭīkaraḥ kuṇḍalikāyāṃ kulmāṣān piṭhirikāyāṃ ca sūpikaṃ paribhuktam /
analyzed: adrākṣīt nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ kuṇḍalikāyām kulmāṣān piṭhirikāyām ca sūpikam paribhuktam
translated: The potter Nandīpāla saw that the beans in the pot and the soup in the pan had been eaten.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punar andhau mātāpitarāv idam avocat /🔽amba tāta kenaite kuṇḍalikāyāṃ kulmāṣāḥ piṭhirikāyāṃ
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar andhau mātā pitarā idam avocat  amba tāta kena ete kuṇḍalikāyām kulmāṣāḥ piṭhirikāyām
translated: And having seen it, he said this to his blind parents:

analyzed: ca sūpikam paribhuktam
translated: Mother, Father, by whom were the beans in the pot and the soup in the pan eaten?

analyzed: tau evam āhatuḥ
translated: They said this:

original: iha te somya nandīpāla aciranirgatasyāśrauṣva argaḍakasyākoṭanaśabdam /
analyzed: iha te somya nandīpāla acira nirgatasya aśrauṣva argaḍakasya ākoṭana śabdam
translated: My dear Nandīpāla, here, not long after you left, we heard the sound of a door being opened.

analyzed: śrutvā ca punar evam vadāvaḥ
translated: Having heard, we would say this:

original: ka eṣa āryaḥ ka eṣa bhadramukhaḥ śanair mandamandam argaḍam ākoṭayati /
analyzed: kaḥ eṣaḥ āryaḥ kaḥ eṣa bhadra mukhaḥ śanais mandamandam argaḍam ākoṭayati
translated: Who is this noble one? Who is this good man slowly and gently knocking on the door?

original: sa evam āha / ahaṃ kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ piṇḍakenārthī /
analyzed: saḥ evam āha aham kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ piṇḍakena arthī
translated: He would say, I am the perfectly awakened Kashyapa, come for alms.

analyzed: tam enam evam vadāvaḥ
translated: We would say to him:

analyzed: praviśatu ārya praviśatu bhadra mukha
translated: Let the noble one enter, let the good man enter.

analyzed: ete kuṇḍalikāyām kulmāṣāḥ piṭhirikāyām sūpikam
translated: Here are the beans in the pot and the soup in the pan.

analyzed: saced ākāṃkṣasi ātmanā gṛhītvā paribhuṃkṣva
translated: If you wish, take them yourself and eat them.

analyzed: bahis gataḥ te upasthāyakaḥ
translated: Your attendant has gone outside.

original: tena te kuṇḍālikāyāṃ kulmāṣāḥ piṭhirikāyāṃ ca sūpikaṃ paribhuktaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena te kuṇḍālikāyām kulmāṣāḥ piṭhirikāyām ca sūpikam paribhuktam bhaviṣyati
translated: He will have eaten the beans in the pot and the soup in the pan.

analyzed: atha nandīpālasya ghaṭīkarasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to Nandin's potter:

analyzed: lābhāḥ me su labdhāḥ yasya me kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ kule tyartham viśvastaḥ viśvāsam
translated: I have gained great gain, in that the perfectly awakened Kashyapa has become so very trusting and confident in my family.

original: āpannaḥ iti viditvā tenaiva prītiprāmodyena saptāham ekaparyaṃkenātināmayati ardhamāsaṃ
analyzed: āpannaḥ iti viditvā tena eva prīti prāmodyena saptāham eka paryaṃkena atināmayati ardha māsam
translated: Knowing this, he spent seven days sitting on the same seat, filled with that very joy and rapture,

analyzed: ca asya satata sahagatā smṛtiḥ kāyam na vijahāti
translated: and for half a month his mindfulness, always present, did not leave his body.

analyzed: sā avyucchinnā kāye vartate
translated: It continues uninterrupted in the body.

original: saptāhaṃ mātāpitroḥ yathā kuṇḍālikāyāḥ kulmāṣam / piṭhirikāyaś ca sūpikam evaṃ kuṇḍikāyā odanaṃ piṭhirikāyāś ca sūpikam /
analyzed: sapta aham mātā pitroḥ yathā kuṇḍālikāyāḥ kulmāṣam piṭhirikāyāḥ ca sūpikam evam kuṇḍikāyāḥ odanam piṭhirikāyāḥ ca sūpikam
translated: For seven days, like the mother and father's pot of beans and pot of soup. Just as the pot of beans and the pot of soup, so the pot of rice and the pot of soup.

analyzed: ekam imam mahā rāja sbu ii
translated: One time, great king,

original: samayaṃ vaibhiḍiṃgīṃ grāmanigamam upaniśritya ahaṃ varṣā upagataḥ /
analyzed: samayam vaibhiḍiṃgīm grāma nigamam upaniśritya aham varṣāḥ upagataḥ
translated: I entered the rainy season retreat relying on the village of Vaibhidī.

analyzed: tasya mama tad prathama varṣiṇā devena vihāraḥ
translated: For me, in that first rainy season, the monastery was flooded.

original: tena khalu samayena nandīpālasya ghaṭīkārasyāveśanaśālā navatṛṇapraticchannā 'bhūt /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena nandīpālasya ghaṭīkārasya āveśana śālā nava tṛṇa praticchannā bhūt
translated: At that time, the workshop of the potter Nandipāla was covered with fresh grass.

original: so 'ham upasthāyakān bhikṣūn āmantrayāmi /🔽gacchata yūyaṃ bhikṣavo nandīpālasya ghaṭīkārasyāveśanaśālāṃ navatṛṇapraticchannām avacchādya mama vihāraṃ chādayata /
analyzed: saḥ ham upasthāyakān bhikṣūn āmantrayāmi  gacchata yūyam bhikṣavaḥ nandīpālasya ghaṭī kārasya āveśana śālām nava tṛṇa praticchannām avacchādya mama vihāram chādayata
translated: I then invited the attendant monks,🔽saying, Go, monks, and cover my monastery with the fresh grass covering from the workshop of the potter Nandipāla.

original: te mama om iti pratiśrutya nandīpālasya ghaṭīkārasya navatṛṇapraticchannām āveśanaśālām avacchādayanti /
analyzed: te mama om iti pratiśrutya nandīpālasya ghaṭī kārasya nava tṛṇa praticchannām āveśana śālām avacchādayanti
translated: They agreed to my request and covered my monastery with the fresh grass covering from the workshop of the potter Nandipāla.

original: tena khalu samayena nandīpālo ghaṭīkaro bahirnirgato 'bhūt kenacid eva karaṇīyena /🔽aśrauṣṭāṃ nandīpālasya A
analyzed: tena khalu samayena nandīpālaḥ ghaṭīkaraḥ bahis nirgataḥ bhūt kenacid eva karaṇīyena  aśrauṣṭām nandīpālasya
translated: At that time, Nāḍikāla, the potter, had gone outside for some business.🔽Nāḍikāla's blind parents heard

analyzed: ghaṭī karasya andhau mātā pitarau āveśana śālāyām avacchādana śabdam
translated: the sound of the roof being covered over in the workshop.

analyzed: śrutvā ca punar evam āhatuḥ
translated: Having heard it, they said this:

original: ka eṣa āryaḥ ka eṣa bhadramukho nandīpālasya ghaṭīkarasya navatṛṇapraticchannām āveśanaśālām avacchādayati /

translated: Who is this noble one, who is this good man covering over the workshop of Nāḍikāla, the potter, with new grass?

analyzed: te evam āhuḥ vayam bhikṣavaḥ kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya upasthāyikāḥ
translated: They said, We are the attendants of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tatprathamavarṣiṇā devena vihāro vṛṣyate /
analyzed: kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tad prathama varṣiṇā devena vihāraḥ vṛṣyate
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa's dwelling is being repaired by the first rain of the gods.

original: te vayaṃ nandīpālasya ghaṭīkārasya navatṛṇapraticchannām āveśanaśālām avacchādya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya vihāraṃ praticchādayāmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam nandīpālasya ghaṭī kārasya nava tṛṇa praticchannām āveśana śālām avacchādya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya vihāram praticchādayāmaḥ
translated: We are covering over the workshop of Nāḍikāla, the potter, with new grass, and covering over the dwelling of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: tāv evam āhatuḥ harata āryā harata bhadramukhā bahirnirgato vaḥ upasthāyakaḥ /
analyzed: tau evam āhatuḥ harata āryāḥ harata bhadra mukhāḥ bahis nirgataḥ vaḥ upasthāyakaḥ
translated: They said this: Take it away, noble ones, take it away, good men. Your attendant has gone outside.

original: tais tām avacchādya mama vihāraḥ praticchāditaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ tām avacchādya mama vihāraḥ praticchāditaḥ
translated: They covered it, and my dwelling was also covered.

original: paścād āgato nandīpālo ghaṭīkaro 'drākṣīn navatṛṇapraticchannām āveśanaśālām avacchāditāṃ /
analyzed: paścāt āgataḥ nandīpālaḥ ghaṭī karaḥ drākṣīt nava tṛṇa praticchannām āveśana śālām avacchāditām
translated: Later, Nāndīpāla the potter came and saw the newly thatched hut covered.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punar andhau mātāpitarāv idam avocat /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar andhau mātā pitarā idam avocat
translated: And having seen it, he said this to his blind parents:

original: amba tāta kenaiṣā navatṛṇapraticchannā āveśanaśālā avacchāditā /
analyzed: amba tāta kena eṣā nava tṛṇa praticchannā āveśana śālā avacchāditā
translated: Mother, Father, by whom was this newly thatched hut covered?

analyzed: tau evam āhatuḥ
translated: They said this:

original: iha te somya nandīpāla aciranirgatasya aśrauṣva navatṛṇapraticchannāyā āveśanaśālāyā avacchādanaśabdam /
analyzed: iha te somya nandīpāla acira nirgatasya aśrauṣva nava tṛṇa praticchannāyāḥ āveśana śālāyāḥ avachādana śabdam
translated: My dear Nāndīpāla, when you had just gone out, we heard the sound of the newly thatched hut being covered.

original: śrutvā ca punar evaṃ vadāvaḥ ka eṣa āryaḥ ka eṣa bhadramukho navatṛṇapraticchannām āveśanaśālām avacchādayati /
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar evam vadāvaḥ kaḥ eṣaḥ āryaḥ kaḥ eṣa bhadra mukhaḥ nava tṛṇa praticchannām āveśana śālām avacchādayati
translated: And having heard it, we said this: 'Who is this noble one, who is this good man covering the newly thatched hut?'

original: te evam āhur vayaṃ bhikṣavaḥ kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasyopasthāyikāḥ /
analyzed: te evam āhuḥ vayam bhikṣavaḥ kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya upasthāyikāḥ
translated: They said this: 'We are the attendants of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tatprathamavarṣiṇā devena vihāro vṛṣyate /
analyzed: kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tad prathama varṣiṇā devena vihāraḥ vṛṣyate
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa's dwelling is being repaired by the first rain of the gods.'

original: te vayaṃ nandīpālasya ghaṭīkarasya navatṛṇapraticchannām āveśanaśālām avacchādya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya vihāraṃ praticchādayāmaḥ /
analyzed: te vayam nandīpālasya ghaṭīkarasya nava tṛṇa praticchannām āveśana śālām avacchādya kāśyapasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya vihāram praticchādayāmaḥ
translated: We covered the potter Nandīpāla's workshop with fresh grass and covered the dwelling of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa.

original: tān āvām evaṃ vadāvaḥ harata āryā harata bhadramukhā bahirnirgato vaḥ upasthāyakaḥ /
analyzed: tān āvām evam vadāvaḥ harata āryāḥ harata bhadra mukhāḥ bahis nirgataḥ vaḥ upasthāyakaḥ
translated: We said to them, 'Take it, Noble Ones, take it, good sirs, your attendant has gone out.'

analyzed: taiḥ eṣā āveśana śālā avacchāditā bhaviṣyati
translated: They covered that workshop.

analyzed: atha nandīpālasya ghaṭīkarasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the potter Nandīpāla:

original: lābhā me sulabdhā yasya me kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ kule 'tyarthaṃ viśvasto viśvāsam SBV II
analyzed: lābhāḥ me su labdhāḥ yasya me kāśyapaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ kule tyartham viśvastaḥ viśvāsam
translated: 'I have gained great gain, in that the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa has become very confident in my family, and has placed his confidence in me.'

original: āpannaḥ iti viditvā tenaiva prītiprāmodyena saptāham ekaparyaṃkenātināmayati ardhamāsaṃ cāsya satatasamitā smṛtiḥ kāyaṃ na jahāti /
analyzed: āpannaḥ iti viditvā tena eva prīti prāmodyena sapta aham eka paryaṃkena atināmayati ardha māsam ca asya satata samitā smṛtiḥ kāyam na jahāti
translated: Knowing this, he spent seven days on a single seat, filled with joy and rapture, and for half a month his mindfulness never left his body.

analyzed: sā ca avyucchinnā kāye vartate
